info.description:
These are the APIs exposed by our backend SDK. To be consumed by the frontend only.
`<tenantId>` in all the APIs are optional. Its default value is `public`
info.title: Frontend Driver Interface

put.description: Returns information about the auth factors of the current user and refreshes the related session claim

parameters.name: apiBasePath
parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

parameters.name: anti-csrf
parameters.description: This will only be here if enabled by the user.

200.description: Information about the auth factors of the current user and optionally the session with a refreshed MFA claim

Set-Cookie.description: Sent in cookie-based sessions if the access token is updated

schema.example: sAccessToken=eyJhb...%3D%3D; Path=/; Expires=Tue, 22 Jun 2021 07:43:07 GMT; HttpOnly; SameSite=Lax

st-access-token.description: Sent in cookie-based sessions if the access token is updated

anti-csrf.description: Sent if enabled by the user

front-token.description: Sent if the access token is updated

get.description: List the TOTP devices of the current user

parameters.name: apiBasePath
parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

parameters.name: anti-csrf
parameters.description: This will only be here if enabled by the user.

200.description: The list of the TOTP devices of the session user

post.description: Creates an unverified totp device

parameters.name: apiBasePath
parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

parameters.name: anti-csrf
parameters.description: This will only be here if enabled by the user.

200.description:
Information about the created (unverified) device. Based on the this,
the user can add the device to their TOTP app and verify it.

403.description: A claim validation error happened during factor setup

reason.example: Completed factors in the session does not satisfy the MFA requirements for auth

post.description: Removes a totp device

parameters.name: apiBasePath
parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

parameters.name: anti-csrf
parameters.description: This will only be here if enabled by the user.

post.description: Checks that the TOTP sent in the body belongs to the totp device (specified by deviceName, belonging to the session user)

parameters.name: apiBasePath
parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

parameters.name: anti-csrf
parameters.description: This will only be here if enabled by the user.

200.description: Verification result and optionally the session with a refreshed MFA claim

Set-Cookie.description: Sent in cookie-based sessions if the access token payload is updated

schema.example: sAccessToken=eyJhb...%3D%3D; Path=/; Expires=Tue, 22 Jun 2021 07:43:07 GMT; HttpOnly; SameSite=Lax

anti-csrf.description: Sent if enabled by the user

front-token.description: Sent if the access token payload is updated

reason.example: Completed factors in the session does not satisfy the MFA requirements for auth

post.description: Start sign in/up process with passwordless

parameters.name: apiBasePath
parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

200.description: Started the passwordless sign in/up process.

deviceId.description: This should be saved on the starting device to enable the manual code entry flow.

preAuthSessionId.description: An identifier that used to identify the login attempt/device.

reason.example: Cannot sign in / up due to security reasons. Please contact support. (IS_SIGN_IN_ALLOWED_FALSE)

403.description: A claim validation error happened during factor setup

reason.example: Completed factors in the session does not satisfy the MFA requirements for auth

parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

post.description: Finish sign in/up process with passwordless

parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

An identifier that used to identify the login attempt/device.

get.description: Get all JSON web keys for JWT verification

parameters.name: apiBasePath
parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

items.description: A JWK that can be used to verify a JWT

alg.description: The algorithm to use when creating the JWT.

parameters.name: apiBasePath
parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

issuer.description: URL using the https scheme with no query or fragment component that the OP asserts as its Issuer Identifier (https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-discovery-1_0.html section 3)

jwks_uri.description: URL for fetching a list JsonWebKey, used for JWT signature verification. Refer to /jwt/jwks.json API in the JWT recipe for JWK details

revocation_endpoint.description: URL of the token revocation endpoint

token_introspection_endpoint.description: URL of the token introspection endpoint

end_session_endpoint.description: URL of the end session endpoint

parameters.name: apiBasePath
parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

get.description: Continues the OAuth2 login flow after the login page

200.description: The next url in the login flow

frontendRedirectTo.description: The URL to redirect the user to

parameters.name: apiBasePath
parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

get.description: Starts the OAuth2 login flow - for a detailed description of all input parameters please see the OAuth2 and OpenID Connect Core specs

302.description: Redirects the user to the login page or back to the client app

parameters.name: apiBasePath
parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

post.description: Exchanges an OAuth2 grant (e.g.: authorization code) for an access token (and optionally a refresh/id token) - for a detailed description of all input parameters please see the OAuth2 and OpenID Connect Core specs

access_token.description: The access token issued by the authorization server.

expires_in.description: The lifetime in seconds of the access token (integer). For example, the value "3600" denotes that the access token will expire in one hour from the time the response was generated.

id_token.description: To retrieve a refresh token request the id_token scope.

refresh_token.description: The refresh token, which can be used to obtain new access tokens. To retrieve it add the scope "offline" to your access token request.

scope.description: The scope of the access token

token_type.description: The type of the token issued

parameters.name: apiBasePath
parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

get.description: Retrieves user information based on the access token passed in the authorization header

401.description: The access token is expired, revoked or malformed

message.example: Invalid or expired OAuth2 access token

parameters.name: apiBasePath
parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

post.description: Revokes an access/refresh token - the client id and secret can also be provided in an authorization header using the Basic scheme

parameters.name: apiBasePath
parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

post.description: Introspects an access/refresh token

active.description: Whether the token is active or not

parameters.name: apiBasePath
parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

post.description: Redirects the user to a page where they can log out and revoke the oauth tokens - for a detailed description of input parameters please see the user initiated logout spec

302.description: Redirects the user to the logout page or back to the client app

parameters.name: apiBasePath
parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

get.description: Redirects the user to a page where they can log out and revoke the oauth tokens

302.description: Redirects the user to the logout page or back to the client app

parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

get.description: Retrieves information about the OAuth2 login

200.description: Information about the current login flow

info.description: Information about the current login flow

tosUri.description: The URI of the client's terms of service.

policyUri.description: The URI of the client's privacy policy.

logoUri.description: The URI of the client's logo.

clientUri.description: The URI of the client we can link to on the login page

parameters.name: apiBasePath
parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

post.description: Logs out the user and revokes the access/refresh tokens based on the id_token_hint passed to the end_session endpoint

200.description: Accepts the logout request specified by the challenge and gets where the user should be redirected to

frontendRedirectTo.description: The URL to redirect the user to

get.description: API endpoint in your application, checked with `verifySession`

parameters.name: apiBasePath
parameters.description: Its value depends on the apiBasePath set by the user

200.description: The session passed verification and went through the application code

401.description: The session doesn't exists or if it needs to be refreshed

403.description: The session exists, but didn't pass a claim validator

deviceId.description: This should be saved on the starting device to enable the manual code entry flow.

preAuthSessionId.description: An identifier that used to identify the login attempt/device.

authCodeResponse.description: Can contain random data other than the two listed below

reason.example: Cannot sign in due to security reasons. Please try resetting your password, use a different login method or contact support. (ERR_CODE_008)
Cannot sign up due to security reasons. Please try resetting your password, use a different login method or contact support. (ERR_CODE_007)
Token generation was not done because of account take over risk. Please contact support. (HAS_OTHER_EMAIL_OR_PHONE)
Cannot sign in / up due to security reasons. Please contact support. (IS_SIGN_IN_ALLOWED_FALSE)

AccessTokenCookie.description: This is an HTTPOnly cookie, set by sign-in and refresh endpoints and present on requests that update the access token
AccessTokenCookie.name: sAccessToken

AccessTokenBearer.description: Returned as the "st-access-token" header from sign-in and refresh endpoints and present on requests that update the access token payload

RefreshTokenBearer.description: This is an HTTPOnly cookie, set by sign-in and refresh endpoints

RefreshTokenCookie.description: Returned as the "st-refresh-token" header from sign-in and refresh endpoints
RefreshTokenCookie.name: sRefreshToken

OAuth2AccessTokenBearer.description: An OAuth2 access token returned by the token or authorization endpoints during OAuth flows
